messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] auction link - question
messages.msgSnippet: Mike, yes I remember them, pretty sad really. Rich ... From: Mike M. Yamaguchi To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com Sent: Friday, November 28, 2003 10:12 PM
messages.messageBody:
Mike, yes I remember them, pretty sad really.

Rich
----- Original Message -----
From: Mike M. Yamaguchi
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, November 28, 2003 10:12 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] auction link - question


Rich,

It's probably one of them modern high-end tsuba for iai-to, like the ones
sold here:

http://japanesesword.net/jpn/misc/tsuba.html


Someone recently listed on eBay this tsuba with matching fuchi/kashira, and
claimed them to be from the Edo period. The set sold for close to $500.00,
as I recall:

http://japanesesword.net/image/misc/tko106.gif




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
Rich,

It's probably one of them modern high-end tsuba for iai-to, like the ones
sold here:

http://japanesesword.net/jpn/misc/tsuba.html


Someone recently listed on eBay this tsuba with matching fuchi/kashira, and
claimed them to be from the Edo period. The set sold for close to $500.00,
as I recall:

http://japanesesword.net/image/misc/tko106.gif

Caution, caution.....


Mike Y.



At 21:39 2003/11/28 +0800, you wrote:
>Hi mike,yes I was just looking at the others and wondering how they could
all look the same, as in age, quality ect without being modern. These would
easily fool a new collector I feel, They look to be fairly well made at
first glance, probably second glance as well.
>
>cheers
>
>Rich

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] auction link - question
messages.msgSnippet: Hi mike,yes I was just looking at the others and wondering how they could all look the same, as in age, quality ect without being modern. These would easily
messages.messageBody:
Hi mike,yes I was just looking at the others and wondering how they could all look the same, as in age, quality ect without being modern. These would easily fool a new collector I feel, They look to be fairly well made at first glance, probably second glance as well.

cheers

Rich
----- Original Message -----
From: Mike M. Yamaguchi
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, November 28, 2003 9:37 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] auction link - question


Rich,

Modern. The seller has seven similar sukashi tsuba listed at the same price:

http://user.auctions.yahoo.co.jp/jp/show/auctions?userID=hiraku36&apg=4&f=&o
1=a&alocale=0jp&at=true

Mike Y.
